wikipedia_page.main: John Venner Hodgson (1913–1970) was a footballer who played in the Football League for Doncaster Rovers and Grimsby Town.

link_mentions.page: List of Grimsby Town F.C. players

response: He had a brief spell as joint manager for Doncaster in February 1958 with former teammate Jack Hodgson following the surprise departure of Peter Doherty. The club was already struggling and within his tenure as manager it lost 10 of its 15 games and was relegated into the third tier. A new manager was appointed and Syd went back to coaching for a year, leaving the club at the end of that season in 1959.
